Title: TagLib: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in TagLib, possibly
    resulting in Denial of Service.

Background.Text: TagLib is a library for reading and editing audio meta data.

Description.Text:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in TagLib:

  • The "analyzeCurrent()" function in ape/apeproperties.cpp contains a division by zero error (CVE-2012-1107).
  • The "parse()" function in inogg/xiphcomment.cpp contains an error when processing the "vendorLength" field (CVE-2012-1108).
  • The "mid()" function in toolkit/tbytevector.cpp contains an integer overflow error (CVE-2012-1584).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to open a specially crafted OGG file with an application using TagLib, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All TagLib users should upgrade to the latest version:

Packages which depend on this library may need to be recompiled. Tools
      such as  revdep-rebuild may assist in identifying  some of these
      packages.
